content.description: Crux is at the top, stick the jug and your clean. safest part of the climb is the upside down start at the lip of the cave, after that the pads are helpful but there is a ledge below you. I blew the crux and wound up falling to the flat (but stood up!) and it hurt.
content.location: at the left cave at the front. Most likely a ton of graffiti & trash. Down climb almost as sketch, exited from left of ledge and found some OK footholds.

content.description: Three caves to the right, starting from the large offwidth crack on the left. Help in finding the start: The first cave from the crack is JUST right of it, at the start of the crack. The second is just right of that cave and above it. The third is on the level of the first cave, right of cave #2. Start on the left side of the cave and head straight up for 5.10, or start on the right side and head up for 5.9.
content.protection: Technically sport or TR, but TR it. Anchors at top. Be creative in backing these up.

content.description: Begins above the cave... just above and to the right of the cave at "Right Of Crack 1". Straight up the face, through the cave and slightly left to the top.
content.protection: Anchors at top. Be creative in backing these up.

content.description: First route to the right of the large crack. Traverse right from the bottom of the crack to around halfway across the cave and head up, following two bolts (I wouldn't trust these) to the top.
content.protection: Anchors at top. Be creative in backing these up.

content.description: Upper tier. Climb around the center cave on either from either side and then up the pocketed face for the finish at the anchor. Climbing up the left side of the cave is probably a little more difficult and requires good balance and a moderate reach. Climbing up the right side of the cave (the horizontal crack) has less moves but few feet.
content.protection: Set up your TR from the two non-sketchy bolts right above the climb and admire the rusted, blown out bolts on your way up.
content.location: Pretty much right in the center of the upper level. Access the top of the rock from the slope nearest the parking lot (right side if you're facing the wall).

content.description: small and tough. may be a hold in the middle that broke off somewhere.
content.location: Walk along the northern part of the park(by the fence) and take a few steps down till you see the cave.

content.description: The leftmost crack on the backside of the main rock, and the only offwidth crack of any real length. A nice combination of offwidth, layback, and face climbing.
content.protection:
I top rope solo-ed this route. Some of the bolts up top are super sketchy, and many of the bolts protecting individual routes aren't redundant.

There's a monster construction eye-bolt bolt close to the edge just above the route. Back it up with the bolt ~15' behind it.
content.location: Walk on the opposite corner of the rock.
